While lost to all her former mirth,</br>Columbia, weeping, bends to earth,</br>And seeks her Hero's grave—</br>Whilst stain'd with blood, she strives to tear,</br>Unseemly, from her fragrant hair</br>The wreaths that Summer gave.

The thoughts that musing Pity pays,</br>And fond Remembrance loves to raise</br>Shall on her steps attend;</br>Still Fancy to herself unkind,</br>Awakes to grief the soften'd mind,</br>And paints the bleeding friend.—

By Hudson's broad descending wave</br>Her ceaseless tears bedew the grave,</br>Where HAMILTON is laid—</br>That sacred spot, with cypress crown'd,</br>Shall jealous Honour watch around,</br>And Truth protect the shade.

O'er him whose doom thy virtues grieve,</br>Aerial forms shall sit at eve,</br>And bend the pensive head;</br>And fall'n by fate's severe command,</br>Imperial Honour's awful hand</br>Shall point his lowly bed.

The warlike dead of ev'ry age,</br>Who fill the fair recording page,</br>Shall leave their sainted rest—</br>And half reclining on his spear,</br>Each wond'ring chief by turns appear</br>To hail the blooming guest.

Great WASHINGTON unknown to yield;</br>MONTGOMERY, from Abram's field—</br>Shall gaze with fix'd delight:</br>Again their Country's wrongs they feel;</br>Again they snatch the gleaming steel,</br>And wish the avenging fight.

But lo!  where sunk in deep despair,</br>Her garments torn, her bosom bare,</br>Impatient FREEDOM lies!</br>Her matted tresses madly spread,</br>To ev'ry sod which wraps the dead,</br>She turns her joyless eyes.

If weak to sooth thy soften'd heart,</br>These pictur'd glories nought impart</br>To dry thy constant tear;</br>If yet in Sorrow's distant eye,</br>Expos'd and pale thou see'st him lie,</br>Where Greenwich Shades appear.

Where'er from time thou court'st relief,</br>The Muse shall still with social grief,</br>With thee her vigils keep:</br>Ev'n VERNON'S lone sepulchral vale</br>Shall learn the sad respected tale,</br>Where sainted relics sleep.</br>
